title: Chicago War Memorials and Military Memorials
name: Chicago War Memorials and Military Memorials
description: The locations of 59 monuments and memorials dedicated to Chicagoans that have served in the armed forces through the years

properties.name: Above and Beyond - National Viet Nam Veterans Art Museum
Bataan-Corregidor Memorial Bridge (Plaque - State Street Bridge)
properties.description: The Bataan-Corregidor Memorial Bridge was first dedicated in 1948 and then rededicated by Mayor Richard M. Daley on the 100th anniversary of Philippine Independence, and on the occasion of Bataan Day, April 9, 1998.

properties.name: Battle of Midway Memorial
properties.description: On June 4, 2001 in Chicago's Midway Airport, Mayor Daley joined World War II veterans in dedicating a sculpture, 'AMERICA', that honors the men and women who fought in the Battle of Midway. The sculpture, located in the airport's A Concourse, reflects ima

properties.name: Butch O'Hare Memorial
properties.description: Memorial to Medal of Honor Recipient Butch O'Hare

properties.name: Camp Douglas Veterans Memorial
properties.description: Site of Civil War Era Prison Camp

properties.name: Chicago Military Academy-Bronzeville
properties.description: The Chicago Military Academy -Bronzeville, is the nation's first public high school run by the Army's Junior Officer Training Corps. The school is housed in the renovated Chicago Landmark, the Eighth Regiment Armory.

properties.name: Chicago Public Library Canaryville Branch
properties.description: At the entrance of the library sit two monuments funded by the neighborhood as well as by the Canaryville Veterans Association. The Canaryville Veterans Association assists neighborhood veterans in need.

properties.name: City Hall Memorial Plaque
properties.description: Chicago's City Hall houses not only the heart and soul of city government but also a beautiful and stately lobby. In that lobby, just east of the north bank of elevators, a bronze plaque honors those who lost their lives in World War I and World War II.

properties.name: Clearing-Park Shops Memorial
properties.description: At 63rd and Narragansett, this neighborhood dedicated the Clearing-Park Shops Memorial on July 4, 1971. The bronze plaque is inscribed: "We the citizens of Clearing, dedicate this memorial to the members of this land of liberty that fought and gave their

properties.name: Confederate Mound Monument
properties.description: Statue of Confederate Infantry soldier above graves of 6,000 Confederate prisoners who died at Chicagos Camp Douglas during the Civil War

properties.name: Elks National Veterans Memorial
properties.description: A monument in the truest sense, the Elks National Veterans Memorial was built in 1926 to honor Americans whose profound sacrifices for the nation can never be recognized by mere words. With its massive dome, heroic sculptures and intricately detailed frie

properties.name: Eternal Flame
properties.description: The Eternal Flame Memorial at Daley Plaza is a granite slab bearing a bronze circular disk containing a natural gas flame that burns perpetually. The inscription reads as follows: Eternal flame in memory of the men and women who have served in our armed f

properties.name: General John Logan Statue
properties.description: Founder of Memorial Day. The Illinois Legislature, with the additional support of the Chicago Park District, commissioned the statue which sits in Grant Park at Michigan Avenue and 9th Street.

properties.name: George Washington Memorial
properties.description: In Chicago's Washington Park stands a replica of a statue erected in France of the first President of the United States, George Washington.

properties.name: Grand Army Of The Republic Rotunda And Hall
properties.description: The Grand Army, established in Chicago during the winter of 1865, was a patriotic association made up of surviving soldiers and sailors of the Civil War and of the militia on active duty in that period on the side of the North. Its main purpose was to hel

properties.name: Harold Washington Library
properties.description: While the City of Chicago honors Harold Washington for his meritorious service to our government, he is also recognized for his achievement as a military veteran. On the north wall of the main lobby is a mosaic mural by Jacob Lawrence entitled Events in t

properties.name: Kennison Memorial
properties.description: David Kennison, a participant in the Boston Tea Party,  was buried in Lincoln Park, once used as a burial ground for important people in Chicago. A boulder now stands in the approximate place of where he is buried.

properties.name: Korean Memorial at Kennedy Park
properties.description: Chicago's Kennedy Park dedicated its Korean War monument on September 15, 1988, making it the country's first memorial to those who served in that conflict.

properties.name: Lincoln Statues
properties.description: Walk through Lincoln Park and you'll see an impressive statue of our 16th President, Abraham Lincoln, standing proudly. It is one of the city's oldest public sculptures.

properties.name: Lincoln the Orator Statue
properties.description: statue: Lincoln the Orator - Abraham Lincoln, 16th President of United States

properties.name: M60 Tank & Monument
properties.description: To all the men and women from the East side neighborhood who answered our countrys call

properties.name: Manuel Perez Jr. Elementary School
properties.description: Manuel Perez saw action in the Philippines at Fort William McKinley in Luzon on February 13, 1945 and demonstrated great heroics.For his heroic achievements during World War II, he was posthumously awarded the Congressional Medal of Honor.

properties.name: Manuel Perez Jr. Plaza
properties.description: Manuel Perez saw action in the Philippines at Fort William McKinley in Luzon on February 13, 1945 and demonstrated great heroics.For his heroic achievements during World War II, he was posthumously awarded the Congressional Medal of Honor.

properties.name: Marshall Field's Memorial Plaques
properties.description: At a ceremony held on November 11, 1946, Marshall Field's company officers and the store's American Legion Post dedicated a bronze plaque which honors the 103 employees who gave their lives in World Wars I and II. Marshall Field's has refurbished their me

properties.name: Mayfair Veterans Memorial
properties.description: The Mayfair Veterans Memorial honors those who have served in WWI, WWII, Korea, Vietnam and Desert Shield/Desert Storm and it was dedicated on November 3, 2001.

properties.name: Midway Airport
properties.description: Originally called the City's Municipal Airport, it was renamed in 1949, seven years after the Battle of Midway occurred.

properties.name: Milton Lee Olive Park
properties.description: PFC Milton Olive III was only 18 at the time of his death in Vietnam, but his heroic acts were so great, that the City of Chicago has honored him in two ways. Chicago is home to Olive Park and Olive-Harvey College both named for this brave soldier.

properties.name: Mural at Our Lady of Guadalupe
properties.description: On Sunday, September 24, 2000, Our Lady of Guadalupe dedicated "Remembrance and Acceptance" a memorial mural created by artists from the National Vietnam Veterans Art Museum. The parish lost more young men in Vietnam than any other church in the country.

properties.name: Nathan Hale Statue
properties.description: A statue of Nathan Hale stands proudly in front of Tribune Tower, a memorial to one of a America's heroes, a true patriot.The statue was erected by the Chicago Tribune, and dedicated on June 4, 1940

properties.name: O'Hare Airport
properties.description: Chicago's O'Hare International Airport, often known as the world's busiest airport, was also once known as Orchard Field. Luggage tags to this day reflect the original name which was changed to honor a World War II hero from Chicago, Edward "Butch" O'Hare

properties.name: Olive/Harvey College
properties.description: In addition to being named for Milton Olive III, the College was named for Carmel B. Harvey, an infantryman who also was awarded the Congressional Medal of Honor posthumously.

properties.name: Our Lady of Guadalupe Monument
properties.description: The parish at Our Lady of Guadalupe suffered tremendous losses during the Vietnam War. In addition to the mural on the Church wall, a monument sits across the street with the following inscription to the 12 men of Our Lady of Guadalupe killed in Vietnam.

properties.name: Philip H. Sheridan Statue
properties.description: The statue of Philip Henry Sheridan, Civil War General,  stands in Chicago on Lake Shore Drive and Belmont.

properties.name: Rainbow Division - Granite Monument
properties.description: In August 1917, the 42nd Rainbow Division was formed from National Guard units. To commemorate the 50th anniversary of the Rainbow Division for which the park is named, on June 18, 1967 the Chicago Park District participated in dedicating this monument

properties.name: Ridge Park
properties.description: The park is home to a number of monuments that pay tribute to veterans. Markers include a field artillery piece of the Revolutionary War, a large stone with a bronze tablet inscribed "Dedicated to the Men from this District who served during several wars.

properties.name: Rosehill Cemetety Civil War Monument
properties.description: Our Heroes: Civil War Monument dedicated to Union soldiers who died in Civil War

properties.name: Rosehill Cemetety Vietnam Memorial
properties.description: Vietnam Memorial dedicated to the memory of over 58,000 Americans who never returned.

properties.name: Rush-Presbyterian Hospital
properties.description: Named for Patriot who served as a surgeon in Revolutionary War. He was one of four physicians who signed the Declaration of Independence.

properties.name: Soldier Field
properties.description: "Dedicated to the men and women of the armed services."  The Soldier Field name, which adorns Chicagos largest memorial to the men and women who served, was deemed so important that city representatives and the Chicago Bears agreed that it will stay.

properties.name: Thaddeus Kosciuszko Statue
properties.description: Because of his brilliant strategies, he is considered to have played a major role in the American win at the Battle of Saratoga, a pivotal point in the War. After his performance in battle, George Washington asked him to secure West Point.

properties.name: The George Washington-Robert Morris-Hyam Salomon Memorial
properties.description: One of the few monuments to honor non military personnel, this statue shows General George Washington clasping hands with civilian supporters, English born Robert Morris and Polish-Jewish emigre Hyam Salomon.

properties.name: U.S.S. Chicago Anchor
properties.description: The anchor that resides at Navy Pier is a remnant of the U.S.S. Chicago. Although there have been four vessels named U.S.S. Chicago, it is the third ship that is honored by the display.

properties.name: Ulysses S. Grant Memorial
properties.description: A memorial to Ulysses S. Grant sits prominently in Lincoln Park while a seated figure of President Lincoln sits in Grant Park.

properties.name: Veterans of all wars plaque on boulder
Vietnam Survivors Memorial
properties.description: Walk In Humidor, Wine Cellar

properties.name: Vietnam Veterans Memorial Plaza
properties.description: On Veterans Day, Friday, November 11, 2005, Mayor Richard M. Daley officially dedicated Vietnam Veterans Memorial Plaza, which commemorates the service of more than 2.5 million men and women who served in the conflict.

properties.name: Washington & Laramie - World War I veterans
World War I Black Soldiers' Memorial
properties.description: One of the most famous landmarks of the Chicago African American Community, Victory was erected after a lengthy campaign led by the Chicago Defender.

properties.name: World War I and II Memorial to Polish American Veterans
World War II veterans memorial water fountain
